item.title: 为什么中国对廉价货币的容忍可能只是暂时的
item.description: 货币市场正在解读中国当局发出的微妙信号，这些信号表明他们正在缓慢压低人民币汇率，以恢复出口竞争力，但分析师们表示，人民币长期走软既不是意图，也不可取。【原文：Currency markets are reading subtle signals from Chinese authorities as an indication they are slowly nudging the yuan lower to regain export competitiveness, but analysts say protracted yuan weakening is neither the intent nor desirable.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，塔吉特将在 "骄傲月 "期间从部分商店撤下以 LGBTQ 为主题的商品
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周四报道，塔吉特（Target）计划在今年 6 月的 "骄傲月 "期间削减部分门店中以 LGBTQ 为主题的商品，去年该零售商的销售额曾因此遭到反弹。【原文：Target is planning to cut LGBTQ-themed merchandise from some of its stores during Pride Month this June, Bloomberg News reported on Thursday, after a backlash hit sales of the retailer last year.】

item.title: 消息人士称，OpenAI 计划于下周一公布谷歌搜索的竞争对手
item.description: 据两位熟知内情的消息人士透露，OpenAI 计划于下周一宣布其人工智能搜索产品，从而加大与搜索大王谷歌竞争的赌注。【原文：OpenAI plans to announce its artificial intelligence-powered search product on Monday, according to two sources familiar with the matter, raising the stakes in its competition with search king Google.】

item.title: 早间竞价：市场上涨但缺乏动力，中国通胀迫在眉睫
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 拜登关注波音公司消防员停工事件
item.description: 美国总统乔-拜登（Joe Biden）周四表示，他对波音公司将其工会消防员拒之门外表示担忧，并向这家美国飞机制造商施压，要求其解决合同纠纷。【原文：U.S. President Joe Biden said on Thursday he is concerned that Boeing has locked out its unionized firefighters, raising pressure on the U.S. planemaker to resolve the contract dispute.】

item.title: 埃隆-马斯克可能被迫在美国证券交易委员会的推特收购调查中再次作证
item.description: 周四，一名联邦法官表示愿意强迫埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）再次就美国证券交易委员会（U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission）对其以 440 亿美元收购推特（Twitter）的调查作证。【原文：A federal judge on Thursday indicated a willingness to compel Elon Musk to testify again in the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission's investigation into his $44 billion takeover of Twitter.】

item.title: 据彭博法律报道，美国证券交易委员会正在调查波音公司有关其安全实践的声明
item.description: 据彭博法律周刊周四报道，美国证券交易委员会正在调查波音公司关于其安全实践的声明，因为今年 1 月阿拉斯加航空公司运营的一架 737 MAX 航班上的一块面板在空中爆炸。【原文：The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission is investigating statements made by Boeing Co. about its safety practices after a panel blew out mid-air on a 737 MAX flight operated by Alaska Airlines in January, Bloomberg Law reported on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国邮政第二季度净亏损缩小至 15 亿美元
item.description: 美国邮政服务公司（United States Postal Service）周四报告称，截至 3 月 31 日的第二季度净亏损为 15 亿美元，而去年同期净亏损为 25 亿美元。【原文：The United States Postal Service on Thursday reported a net loss of $1.5 billion for the second quarter ended March 31, compared to a net loss of $2.5 billion a year ago.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，中国电动汽车制造商极客电动车在美国的首次公开募股（IPO）定价最高，将融资4.41亿美元
item.description: 一位熟悉内情的人士称，中国电动汽车制造商紫光智能科技周四在美国首次公开募股（IPO）的定价达到了预期区间的顶点，共募集资金4.41亿美元。【原文：Chinese electric vehicle maker Zeekr Intelligent Technology priced its U.S. initial public offering (IPO) at the top of its indicated range on Thursday, raising $441 million, a person familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 墨西哥 Bankaool 计划 2026 年登陆美国股市
item.description: 随着母公司 Grupo OMNi 寻求融资以资助该贷款机构的发展，一位高层管理人员表示，墨西哥贷款机构 Bankaool 预计将于 2026 年初在美国股市上市。【原文：Mexican lender Bankaool expects to debut on the U.S. stock market by early 2026, a top executive said, as parent company Grupo OMNi looks to raise money to fund the lender's growth.】

item.title: 西联汇款在中断 3 个月后恢复对古巴的汇款服务
item.description: 西联汇款公司（Western Union）周四证实，在三个多月前系统崩溃后，该公司已恢复了从美国到古巴的汇款服务，为古巴人及其在美国的亲友恢复了一条重要的生命线。【原文：Western Union confirmed on Thursday it had resumed its remittance service from the U.S. to Cuba after the system collapsed more than three months earlier, restoring a vital lifeline for Cubans and their friends and families in the U.S.】

item.title: 美国机构称特斯拉干扰纽约工厂工会组织工作
item.description: 特斯拉公司发言人周四表示，美国一家劳工机构指控特斯拉禁止纽约水牛城一家装配厂的工人使用手机和其他设备，从而阻止他们组织工会。【原文：Tesla has been accused by a U.S. labor agency of discouraging workers at a Buffalo, New York assembly plant from union organizing by barring them from using phones and other devices, an agency spokeswoman said on Thursday.】

item.title: 福特考虑 2030 年后在欧洲提供汽油车和混合动力车
item.description: 底特律汽车制造商福特汽车周四表示，福特汽车正考虑在2030年以后在欧洲推出汽油车和混合动力车，这改变了该公司最初在欧洲推出全电动车阵容的计划。【原文：Ford Motor is considering offering gas-powered vehicles and hybrids beyond 2030 in Europe, a change from its initial plan for an all-electric lineup in the region, the Detroit automaker said on Thursday.】

item.title: 独家报道：消息人士称，电力生产商 Calpine 正在探索包括以 300 亿美元出售在内的各种方案
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，六年前将美国电厂运营商卡尔派恩公司（Calpine Corp）私有化的投资公司正在探讨各种方案，包括公司出售、首次公开募股或股权剥离，包括债务在内的估值约为 300 亿美元。【原文：The investment firms that took U.S. power plant operator Calpine Corp private six years ago are exploring options that include a company sale, an initial public offering or a stake divestment at a valuation of about $30 billion, including debt, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，苹果将利用其芯片为人工智能服务器提供动力
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周四报道，苹果公司今年将通过其内部芯片驱动的数据中心提供一些即将推出的人工智能功能，因为这家 iPhone 制造商希望在其产品中集成生成式人工智能。【原文：Apple will deliver some of its upcoming artificial intelligence features this year through data centers powered by its own in-house chips, Bloomberg News reported on Thursday, as the iPhone maker looks to integrate generative AI in its products.】

item.title: 据彭博社报道，英国石油公司希望购买特斯拉在美国的超级充电站站点
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周四报道，英国石油公司的电动充电部门热衷于收购特斯拉在美国的 TSLA.O 超级充电站点。【原文：BP's electric charging unit is keen on buying Tesla's TSLA.O Supercharging sites in the United States, Bloomberg News reported on Thursday.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，T-Mobile、Verizon 正在洽谈收购 US Cellular 的部分股权
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周四报道，T-Mobile 和 Verizon 通信公司正在洽谈分别收购美国联合蜂窝公司（United States Cellular）部分股份的交易。【原文：T-Mobile and Verizon Communications are in talks to buy parts of United States Cellular in separate transactions, the Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday.】

item.title: Robinhood 在交易之外取得进展
item.description: 分析师表示，由于市场波动和监管风险给传统业务的近期前景蒙上阴影，Robinhood Markets 的新产品套件（包括信用卡和期货交易平台）对推动业务增长至关重要。【原文：Robinhood Markets' suite of new products, including its credit card and futures trading platform, will be crucial to drive growth as market fluctuations and regulatory risks cloud the near-term outlook for its legacy business, analysts said.】

item.title: 美国 30 年期固定利率抵押贷款降至 7.09%，但仍过高，难以推动住房市场发展
item.description: 在经济活动出现放缓迹象的情况下，美国抵押贷款利率本周出现了一个多月以来的首次下降，但仍然过高，无法对房地产市场起到明显的推动作用。【原文：U.S. mortgage rates fell this week for the first time in more than a month amid signs of slowing economic activity, but remain too high to provide a significant boost to the housing market.】

item.title: Citgo 石油公司公布第一季度利润为 4.1 亿美元
item.description: 炼油商 Citgo Petroleum 周四公布，其第一季度净利润从去年同期的 9.37 亿美元下降至 4.10 亿美元，降幅达 56%。【原文：Oil refiner Citgo Petroleum on Thursday reported its first quarter net fell 56% to $410 million, from $937 million in the same period a year ago.】

item.title: 意大利倍耐力在第一季度营业利润超过预期后确认指导原则
item.description: 意大利轮胎制造商倍耐力（Pirelli）周四表示，由于集团受益于效率的提高，今年第一季度调整后营业利润增长了 5.8%。【原文：Italian tyre-maker Pirelli said on Thursday its adjusted operating profit rose 5.8% in the first quarter of the year, as the group benefited from efficiencies.】

item.title: 委内瑞拉总统之子称该国愿意向中国偿还 100 亿美元债务
item.description: 委内瑞拉总统尼古拉斯-马杜罗之子、立法者尼古拉斯-马杜罗-格拉周四在接受路透社采访时表示，委内瑞拉对偿还欠中国的 100 亿美元债务持开放态度。【原文：Venezuela is open to paying its $10 billion debt to China, lawmaker Nicolas Maduro Guerra, son of President Nicolas Maduro, told Reuters in an interview on Thursday.】

item.title: 巴西市场下跌，央行拆分决定引发对鸽派转向的担忧
item.description: 巴西市场周四下跌，原因是央行在一次分歧较大的降息决定中，现政府任命的官员主张更大幅度的降息，这引发了市场对即将出台的受政治影响的鸽派货币政策的担忧。【原文：Brazil's markets fell on Thursday after the central bank cut rates in a split decision that saw appointees of the current government advocating for a larger reduction, sparking concerns of a forthcoming dovish monetary policy influenced by politics.】

item.title: 消息人士称欧佩克在全球石油需求展望中转向 "呼吁欧佩克+
item.description: 两位接近此事的消息人士称，欧佩克将停止在其月度石油报告中公布全球对本国原油需求的计算结果，转而关注对更广泛的欧佩克+集团石油需求的预测。【原文：OPEC will stop publishing a calculation of the world's demand for its own crude in its monthly oil report, two sources close to the matter said, focusing instead on forecasts for demand for oil from the wider OPEC+ group.】

item.title: 解说员：先进的人工智能模型落入坏人之手会带来哪些风险？
item.description: 据路透社周三报道，拜登政府准备开辟一条新战线，努力保护美国的人工智能不受中国和俄罗斯的影响，初步计划在最先进的人工智能模型周围设置防护栏。【原文：The Biden administration is poised to open up a new front in its effort to safeguard U.S. AI from China and Russia with preliminary plans to place guardrails around the most advanced AI models, Reuters reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美国运输部监察机构将就美联航的维修做法对 FAA 进行审计
item.description: 美国运输部监察长办公室周四表示，美国运输部监察长将对联邦航空管理局对美联航维修做法的监督进行审计。【原文：The U.S. Transportation Department's watchdog will audit the Federal Aviation Administration's oversight of United Airlines maintenance practices, the Office of Inspector General said on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国最高法院裁定华纳音乐公司在版权损害赔偿案中败诉
item.description: 美国最高法院周四在迈阿密一位音乐制作人与华纳音乐公司（Warner Music）就说唱歌手弗洛-里达（Flo Rida）的一首歌曲展开的法律纠纷中做出了有利于该制作人的裁决，解决了版权案件中关于金钱损失索赔时限的争议。【原文：The U.S. Supreme Court on Thursday ruled in favor of a Miami music producer in a legal fight with Warner Music over a song by rapper Flo Rida, resolving a dispute over the time limit for claiming monetary damages in copyright cases.】

item.title: 贝恩资本向商业服务公司 Sikich 投资 2.5 亿美元
item.description: 贝恩资本（Bain Capital）周四表示，将获得商业服务公司 Sikich 价值 2.5 亿美元的少数股权，Sikich 计划将这笔投资用于资助其扩张计划。【原文：Bain Capital is picking up a minority stake worth $250 million in business services firm Sikich, which is planning to deploy the investment to finance its expansion plans, the companies said on Thursday.】

item.title: 美联储滞后，欧洲利率开始下降
item.description: 曾经齐心协力对抗通胀的全球央行开始分散，欧洲利率制定者转为鸽派，而美国联邦储备委员会则对过早降息保持谨慎。【原文：Global central banks that moved together to battle inflation are starting to scatter, with European rate setters turning dovish while the U.S. Federal Reserve stays cautious about cutting too soon.】

item.title: 美国每周申请失业救济人数增幅超过预期
item.description: 随着劳动力市场稳步放缓，上周新申请失业救济金的美国人数增幅超过预期。【原文：The number of Americans filing new claims for unemployment benefits increased more than expected last week as the labor market steadily eases.】
